items.message: The water level in the Monktonmead Brook is high and rising. Intense rain has fallen, with over 30mm in the last two hours recorded at Ryde. This is about half a month’s total and is similar to the storm on 27th July. In the next couple of hours, water may begin to flow across the railway tracks, upstream of St Johns Station. Surface water may already be causing impacts as drains become overloaded. Property flooding is not currently expected at this time but we will keep this under review. Further thundery showers are possible this morning and over the next 24 hours. Water levels will remain very high until at least midday. Our operational staff will keep the Monktonmead Brook clear of reported blockages. Please consider moving vehicles from depots located next to the river and railway line. We will update this message by 18:00 02/08/2021 or earlier as conditions develop.

The water level in the Monktonmead Brook continues to rise. 32mm of rain was recorded in just two hours at Ryde early this morning, which is over a month’s worth. This morning at St John's Station water could flow from the railway tracks into the main buildings at the station depot. It could also flood outbuildings and plant and vehicles near Park and Rink Road. Heavy showers may continue to affect the area today. With further rain water levels may not fall until at least midday (2/08/2021) with flood impacts continuing until then. Flood water across the railway tracks and in buildings could be very deep. Our operational staff are in the area working to keep the river clear of blockages. We continue to monitor the forecast. Please take action to protect property and consider moving vehicles away from low lying areas and depots next to the railway line. This Flood Warning will be updated by 18:00 on 2/08/2021.

River levels in the Uck have now fallen from their peak and are nearing normal levels. Monday morning should be relatively dry and so the river should return to normal this afternoon (02/08/2021). Flood impacts will ease, but small amounts of water may remain in fields, gardens and on rural roads. However, further showers which could be intense, are forecast for Tuesday (03/08/2021) and the rest of the week. If the more intense rain falls this week on the River Uck, the risk of flooding could return. Please remain prepared for further potential periods of flood risk. We will continue to monitor the levels and forecast. We will reissue this message if the risk of flooding increases.

The River Uck at Buxted has fallen overnight and is now nearing normal levels. Monday morning should be relatively dry and so the river should return to normal this afternoon (02/08/2021). Flood impacts will ease, but small amounts of water may remain in fields, gardens and on rural roads. No new property flooding is expected. However, further showers which could be intense, are forecast for Tuesday (03/08/2021) and the rest of the week. If the more intense rain falls this week on the River Uck, the risk of flooding could return. Please take care around flood water and avoid driving through it. We will reissue this message if the river level rises and the risk of flooding returns.
